direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve adding key-value pairs to the map, but the indexed version allows specifying the insertion position.
Both methods modify the map by either adding or removing key-value pairs, and both update the internal state of the map.
Both methods involve adding multiple key-value pairs to the map, but putAll adds all entries from another map.
Both methods involve adding multiple key-value pairs to the map, but the indexed version allows specifying the insertion position for the first entry.
Both methods involve modifying the values associated with keys, but setValue allows specifying the index of the key to modify.
Both methods involve removing elements from the map, but remove(int) removes the element at a specified index.
Both methods handle cases where the key is not present in the map, although get returns null while put adds a new entry.
Both methods are identical in functionality, adding or updating a key-value pair in the map.
Both methods involve adding multiple key-value pairs to the map, but the external method adds all entries from another map.
